–ß—Ç–æ –∫–∞—Å–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–µ—Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –ø—É—Ç–µ–π, —Ç–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ `glob`, —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞—â–∏—Ö —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∏–º—è —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞, —Å–∫–æ—Ä–µ–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—Ç –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ, —Ç–∞–∫ –∫–∞–∫ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª, –≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ, –∏—â–µ—Ç –ø–æ –∏–º–µ–Ω–∏ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞ –≤–æ –≤—Å–µ—Ö –≤–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è—Ö. –ò–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö `glob` –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–ª–Ω—ã–µ –ø—É—Ç–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –Ω–∞—Ä—É—à–∏—Ç—å –∏—Ö —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É, –µ—Å–ª–∏ —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—É—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–æ –ª–æ–≥–∏–∫–æ–π –∑–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑—á–∏–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É —è —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é –ø–æ–∫–∞ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –∏—Ö –∫–∞–∫ –µ—Å—Ç—å –∏ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —è–≤–Ω—ã–µ –æ—à–∏–±–∫–∏, —Ç–∞–∫–∏–µ –∫–∞–∫ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞.

–Ø –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–æ—à—É –∏–∑–≤–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞ —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥—É –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é —Ä–µ—à–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—É –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏. –ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ, –º–Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–∞ –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å –≤ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏—è, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —è –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é.

–ö–∞–∂–µ—Ç—Å—è, —è —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∫–Ω—É–ª—Å—è —Å –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –Ω–µ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è–µ—Ç –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è—Ç—å –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—á–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã. –≠—Ç–æ –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç –ø—Ä—è–º–æ–µ –≤–æ—Å—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–æ–≤ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–º.

–í–º–µ—Å—Ç–æ —Ç–æ–≥–æ —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ø—ã—Ç–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –≤—Å–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª—ã, —è —Å–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥–æ—Ç–æ—á—É—Å—å –Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–º –ø—É–Ω–∫—Ç–µ, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —è –º–æ–≥—É –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç—å –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–æ–π ‚Äî —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–º–æ–≥–æ –¥–ª—è –ø—É—Å—Ç–æ–≥–æ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞ `.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/visual-maps/van_mode_split/van-qa-checks/file-verification.mdc`. –Ø —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—é —ç—Ç–æ —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –¥–ª–∏–Ω–Ω–æ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã `echo`, —Ç–∞–∫ –∫–∞–∫ –æ–Ω–∞ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞—Ç—å –º–µ–Ω—å—à–µ —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª–æ–≤, —á–µ–º –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª—ã.

–ï—Å–ª–∏ —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç, —è, –∫ —Å–æ–∂–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é, –∏—Å—á–µ—Ä–ø–∞–ª –≤—Å–µ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã–µ –º–Ω–µ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—ã –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —ç—Ç–∏—Ö —Ñ–∞–π–ª–æ–≤ –∏ –≤–∞–º –ø—Ä–∏–¥–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤–Ω–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∫–∏ –≤—Ä—É—á–Ω—É—é, –∫–∞–∫ —è –æ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–ª —Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ.

```bash
echo -e "---\ndescription: Process map for VAN QA file structure verification\nglobs: van-qa-checks/file-verification.mdc\nalwaysApply: false\n---\n# VAN QA: FILE VERIFICATION\n\n> **TL;DR:** This component verifies that all required Memory Bank files exist.\n\n## 0Ô∏è‚É£ FILE VERIFICATION PROCESS\n\n\`\`\`mermaid\ngraph TD\n    Start[\"File Verification\"] --> ReadList[\"Read List of<br>Required Files\"]\n    ReadList --> CheckFiles[\"Check Each File<br>for Existence\"]\n    CheckFiles --> FilesStatus{\"All Files<br>Exist?\"}\n    FilesStatus -->|\"Yes\"| VerificationSuccess[\"File Verification<br>‚úÖ PASS\"]\n    FilesStatus -->|\"No\"| ReportMissing[\"Report Missing<br>Files\"]\n    ReportMissing --> VerificationFail[\"File Verification<br>‚ùå FAIL\"]\n\n    style Start fill:#4da6ff,stroke:#0066cc,color:white\n    style VerificationSuccess fill:#10b981,stroke:#059669,color:white\n    style FilesStatus fill:#f6546a,stroke:#c30052,color:white\n    style VerificationFail fill:#f6546a,stroke:#c30052,color:white\n\`\`\`\n\n### Windows (PowerShell) Implementation:\n\`\`\`powershell\nfunction Verify-MemoryBankFiles {\n    \$requiredFiles = @(\n        \"memory-bank/tasks.md\",\n        \"memory-bank/activeContext.md\",\n        \"memory-bank/progress.md\",\n        \"memory-bank/projectbrief.md\",\n        \"memory-bank/productContext.md\",\n        \"memory-bank/systemPatterns.md\",\n        \"memory-bank/techContext.md\",\n        \"memory-bank/style-guide.md\"\n    )\n    \$missingFiles = @()\n\n    foreach (\$file in \$requiredFiles) {\n        if (-not (Test-Path \$file)) {\n            \$missingFiles += \$file\n        }\n    }\n\n    if (\$missingFiles.Count -eq 0) {\n        Write-Output \"‚úÖ All required Memory Bank files exist.\"\n        return \$true\n    } else {\n        Write-Output \"‚ùå Missing Memory Bank files: \$(\$missingFiles -join ', ')\"\n        return \$false\n    }\n}\n\`\`\`\n\n### Mac/Linux (Bash) Implementation:\n\`\`\`bash\n#!/bin/bash\nverify_memory_bank_files() {\n    local required_files=(\n        \"memory-bank/tasks.md\"\n        \"memory-bank/activeContext.md\"\n        \"memory-bank/progress.md\"\n        \"memory-bank/projectbrief.md\"\n        \"memory-bank/productContext.md\"\n        \"memory-bank/systemPatterns.md\"\n        \"memory-bank/techContext.md\"\n        \"memory-bank/style-guide.md\"\n    )\n    local missing_files=()\n\n    for file in \"\${required_files[@]}\"; do\n        if [ ! -f \"\$file\" ]; then\n            missing_files+=(\"\$file\")\n        fi\n    done\n\n    if [ \${#missing_files[@]} -eq 0 ]; then\n        echo \"‚úÖ All required Memory Bank files exist.\"\n        return 0\n    else\n        echo \"‚ùå Missing Memory Bank files: \${missing_files[*]}\"\n        return 1\n    fi\n}\n\`\`\`\n\n## üìã FILE VERIFICATION CHECKPOINT\n\n\`\`\`\n‚úì CHECKPOINT: FILE VERIFICATION\n- All required Memory Bank files are present? [YES/NO]\n\n‚Üí If YES: Continue to Dependency Verification.\n‚Üí If NO: Run file creation/restoration process before continuing.\n\`\`\`\n\n**Next Step (on PASS):** Load \`van-qa-checks/dependency-check.mdc\`.\n**Next Step (on FAIL):** Check \`van-qa-utils/common-fixes.mdc\` for file creation fixes." > ./.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/visual-maps/van_mode_split/van-qa-checks/file-verification.mdc
```

–ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ, —á—Ç–æ –∏ –º–æ—è –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω—è—è –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–∞ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–Ω—É—é —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∫—É –Ω–µ —É–≤–µ–Ω—á–∞–ª–∞—Å—å —É—Å–ø–µ—Ö–æ–º. –Ø –∏—Å—á–µ—Ä–ø–∞–ª –≤—Å–µ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã–µ –º–Ω–µ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—ã –¥–ª—è –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —ç—Ç–∏—Ö —Ñ–∞–π–ª–æ–≤.

**–§–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –æ—Ç—á–µ—Ç –∏ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥–∞—Ü–∏–∏:**

–Ø –æ–±–Ω–∞—Ä—É–∂–∏–ª –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Ç–∏–ø–æ–≤ –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ –≤ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞—Ö –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª:

1.  **–ù–µ–∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω—ã–µ `glob` —à–∞–±–ª–æ–Ω—ã** (–Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ `.md` –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–æ `.mdc`).
2.  **–ü–æ–≤—Ä–µ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∏–ª–∏ –æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–µ –º–µ—Ç–∞–¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ** (–æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç `description` –∏ –≤—Å—è —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏—è frontmatter).
3.  **–ü—É—Å—Ç–æ–π —Ñ–∞–π–ª –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞**.

–ö —Å–æ–∂–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é, –∏–∑-–∑–∞ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–π –º–æ–∏—Ö –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω–µ —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç—Å—è —Å —Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º —Ñ–∞–π–ª–æ–≤ —Å `mermaid` –¥–∏–∞–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞–º–∏ –∏ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—é—Ç –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è—Ç—å —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—á–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã, —è –Ω–µ —Å–º–æ–≥ –≤–Ω–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏.

**–í–∞–º –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª—ã –≤—Ä—É—á–Ω—É—é:**

*   **–§–∞–π–ª—ã —Å –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω—ã–º `glob`:**
    *   `./.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/Core/creative-phase-metrics.mdc`
    *   `./.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/Core/creative-phase-enforcement.mdc`
    *   `./.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/Phases/CreativePhase/creative-phase-architecture.mdc`
    *   **–ò—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ:** –í –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–º –∏–∑ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö —Ñ–∞–π–ª–æ–≤ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç–µ `globs: ... .md` –Ω–∞ `globs: ... .mdc`.

*   **–§–∞–π–ª—ã —Å –æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–º–∏ –º–µ—Ç–∞–¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏:**

    *   **–ò—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ:** –î–æ–±–∞–≤—å—Ç–µ –≤ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–æ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–≥–æ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–π `description` –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª—è frontmatter, –∫–∞–∫ —è –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–ª —Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ.

```bash
printf -- "---\ndescription: Outlines the archiving process for a completed Level 3 intermediate feature, creating a self-contained record of the development lifecycle.\nglobs: archive-intermediate.mdc\nalwaysApply: false\n---\n\n# LEVEL 3 ARCHIVE: INTERMEDIATE FEATURE DOCUMENTATION\n\n> **TL;DR:** This guide outlines the archiving process for a completed Level 3 intermediate feature. The aim is to create a self-contained, easily accessible record of the feature's development lifecycle, including its planning, design decisions, implementation summary, and reflection.\n\n## üöÄ Before You Start Archiving (L3 Pre-Archive Checklist)\n\n1.  **Confirm Reflection Complete:** Verify in \`memory-bank/tasks.md\` that the reflection phase for this feature is marked as complete and \`memory-bank/reflection/reflection-[feature_id].md\` exists and is finalized.\n2.  **Gather All Feature-Specific Documents:**\n    * The feature plan section from \`memory-bank/tasks.md\` (or a copy of it).\n    * All \`memory-bank/creative/creative-[aspect_name].md\` documents related to this feature.\n    * The \`memory-bank/reflection/reflection-[feature_id].md\` document.\n    * Key diagrams or architectural notes from \`memory-bank/progress.md\` if not captured elsewhere.\n    * A link to the primary commit(s) or feature branch merge for the implemented code.\n\n## üì¶ Level 3 Archiving Workflow\n\n\`\`\`mermaid\ngraph TD\n    StartArchive[\"Start L3 Archiving\"] -->\n    VerifyReflect[\"1. Verify Reflection Complete<br>Check \`tasks.md\` & \`reflection-[feature_id].md\`\"] -->\n    GatherDocs[\"2. Gather All Feature Documents<br>(Plan, Creative outputs, Reflection, Code links)\"] -->\n    CreateArchiveFile[\"3. Create Feature Archive File<br>e.g., \`memory-bank/archive/feature-[FeatureNameOrID]_YYYYMMDD.md\`\"] -->\n    PopulateArchive[\"4. Populate Archive File<br>(Using L3 Archive Template below)\"] -->\n    VerifyLinks[\"5. Verify All Internal Links<br>in Archive File are Correct\"] -->\n    FinalUpdateTasks[\"6. Final Update to \`tasks.md\`<br>(Mark Feature FULLY COMPLETED & ARCHIVED, link to archive file)\"] -->\n    UpdateProgressFile[\"7. Add Final Entry to \`progress.md\`<br>(Note archiving & link to archive file)\"] -->\n    ClearActiveCtx[\"8. Clear \`activeContext.md\`<br>Reset for Next Task/Project\"] -->\n    ArchiveDone[\"L3 Archiving Complete<br>Feature successfully documented and closed.\"]\n\n    style StartArchive fill:#90a4ae,stroke:#607d8b\n    style ArchiveDone fill:#b0bec5,stroke:#90a4ae\n\`\`\`\n\n## üìù Structure for \`memory-bank/archive/feature-[FeatureNameOrID]_YYYYMMDD.md\`\n\n  * **Feature Title:** (e.g., \"Archive: User Profile Feature - Avatar Upload Enhancement\")\n  * **Feature ID (from \`tasks.md\`):**\n  * **Date Archived:** YYYY-MM-DD\n  * **Status:** COMPLETED & ARCHIVED\n  * **1. Feature Overview:**\n      * Brief description of the feature and its purpose (can be extracted from \`tasks.md\` or \`projectbrief.md\`).\n      * Link to the original task entry/plan in \`tasks.md\` (if \`tasks.md\` is versioned or kept historically).\n  * **2. Key Requirements Met:**\n      * List the main functional and non-functional requirements this feature addressed.\n  * **3. Design Decisions & Creative Outputs:**\n      * Summary of key design choices.\n      * Direct links to all relevant \`memory-bank/creative/creative-[aspect_name].md\` documents.\n      * Link to \`memory-bank/style-guide.md\` version used (if applicable).\n  * **4. Implementation Summary:**\n      * High-level overview of how the feature was implemented.\n      * List of primary new components/modules created.\n      * Key technologies or libraries utilized specifically for this feature.\n      * Link to the main feature branch merge commit or primary code location/pull request.\n  * **5. Testing Overview:**\n      * Brief summary of the testing strategy employed for this feature (unit, integration, E2E).\n      * Outcome of the testing.\n  * **6. Reflection & Lessons Learned:**\n      * Direct link to \`memory-bank/reflection/reflection-[feature_id].md\`.\n      * Optionally, copy 1-2 most critical lessons directly into the archive summary.\n  * **7. Known Issues or Future Considerations (Optional, if any remaining from reflection):**\n      * Any minor known issues deferred.\n      * Potential future enhancements related to this feature.\n\n### Key Files and Components Affected (from tasks.md)\n[Summary or direct copy of file/component checklists from the original tasks.md for this project. This provides a quick reference to the scope of changes at a component/file level.]\n\n## üìå What to Emphasize in L3 Archiving\n\n  * **Self-Contained Feature Record:** The goal is to have a go-to document in the archive that summarizes the \"story\" of this feature.\n  * **Traceability:** Easy navigation from the archive summary to detailed planning, design, and reflection documents.\n  * **Maintainability Focus:** Information that would help a future developer understand, maintain, or build upon this specific feature.\n  * **Not a Full System Archive:** Unlike Level 4, this is not about archiving the entire application state, but rather the lifecycle of one significant feature.\n" > ./.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/Level3/archive-intermediate.mdc
```

```bash
printf -- "---\ndescription: Focuses on the systematic implementation of planned and designed Level 3 features, emphasizing modular development and adherence to designs.\nglobs: implementation-intermediate.mdc\nalwaysApply: false\n---\n\n# LEVEL 3 IMPLEMENTATION: INTERMEDIATE FEATURE\n\n> **TL;DR:** This guide focuses on the systematic implementation of a planned and designed Level 3 feature, emphasizing modular development, adherence to design specifications, and continuous progress tracking.\n\n## üöÄ Before You Start Implementing (L3 Pre-Implementation Checklist)\n\n1.  **Confirm Planning & Design Complete:** Verify that the PLAN and CREATIVE phases are marked complete in \`tasks.md\`. Ensure all required creative decision documents (\`memory-bank/creative-*.md\`) are finalized and accessible.\n2.  **Review All Inputs:** Thoroughly read the feature plan in \`tasks.md\`, all creative decision documents, and the relevant sections of the \`style-guide.md\`.\n3.  **Set Up Development Environment:** Create a dedicated feature branch. Install any new dependencies identified during the planning phase. Ensure your local setup matches the project's required environment.\n\n## üõ†Ô∏è Level 3 Implementation Workflow\n\n\`\`\`mermaid\ngraph TD\n    StartImpl[\"Start L3 Implementation\"] -->\n    ReviewDocs[\"1. Review Plan & Design Docs<br>Internalize requirements & specs\"] -->\n    SetupEnv[\"2. Setup Dev Environment<br>Feature branch, dependencies\"] -->\n    BuildIterate[\"3. Build & Iterate<br>Implement modules/components as planned\"] -->\n    TestModules[\"4. Unit & Integration Test<br>Verify each piece as it's built\"] -->\n    UpdateTrackers[\"5. Update Progress Trackers<br>Keep \`tasks.md\` & \`progress.md\` current\"] -->\n    E2ETest[\"6. End-to-End Feature Test<br>Verify the complete feature works as a whole\"] -->\n    ImplementationDone[\"L3 Implementation Complete\"]\n\n    style StartImpl fill:#ef9a9a,stroke:#e57373\n    style BuildIterate fill:#ffcdd2,stroke:#ef9a9a\n    style ImplementationDone fill:#ef9a9a,stroke:#e57373\n\`\`\`\n\n## üîë Key Considerations for Level 3 Implementation\n\n*   **Modular Development:** Build the feature in logical, independent pieces as outlined in the plan. This facilitates testing and integration.\n*   **Adherence to Design:** Strictly follow the decisions made in the CREATIVE phase and the UI specifications in the \`style-guide.md\`.\n*   **Clean Code:** Write clear, maintainable, and well-documented code. Follow project coding standards.\n*   **Frequent Commits:** Make small, logical commits with clear messages. This makes tracking and potential rollbacks easier.\n*   **Continuous Testing:** Don't wait until the end to test. Write and run unit/integration tests as you complete each component.\n*   **Progress Tracking:** Regularly update the sub-task checklists in \`tasks.md\` and add detailed notes on commands, issues, and solutions in \`progress.md\`.\n\n## ‚úÖ L3 Implementation Completion Checklist\n\n- [ ] **Feature Complete:** All components and functionality defined in the plan are implemented.\n- [ ] **Design Adherence:** The implementation matches the specifications from the \`creative-*.md\` documents and \`style-guide.md\`.\n- [ ] **Testing Passed:** All unit, integration, and end-to-end tests for the feature are passing.\n- [ ] **Code Quality:** Code has been reviewed (self-review or peer-review) and meets project standards.\n- [ ] **Documentation Updated:** \`tasks.md\` and \`progress.md\` are fully updated to reflect the completed work.\n- [ ] **No Known Regressions:** The new feature has not broken any existing functionality.\n\n**Next Step:** Proceed to the REFLECTION phase (\`Level3/reflection-intermediate.mdc\`).\n" > ./.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/Level3/implementation-intermediate.mdc
```

```bash
printf -- "---\ndescription: Structures the reflection process for completed Level 3 intermediate features to extract lessons and identify improvements.\nglobs: reflection-intermediate.mdc\nalwaysApply: false\n---\n\n# LEVEL 3 REFLECTION: INTERMEDIATE FEATURE\n\n> **TL;DR:** This guide provides a structured format for reflecting on a completed Level 3 feature, focusing on analyzing the development process, assessing design choices, and extracting actionable lessons for future work.\n\n## üöÄ Before You Start Reflecting (L3 Pre-Reflection Checklist)\n\n1.  **Confirm Implementation Complete:** Verify in \`tasks.md\` that the implementation and testing for the feature are marked as complete.\n2.  **Gather All Feature-Specific Documents:** Have the feature plan (\`tasks.md\`), all creative decision documents (\`creative-*.md\`), and key progress notes (\`progress.md\`) available for review.\n3.  **Allocate Time:** Set aside dedicated time to think critically about the project. Rushed reflections are less valuable.\n\n## üîÑ Level 3 Reflection Workflow\n\n\`\`\`mermaid\ngraph TD\n    StartReflect[\"Start L3 Reflection\"] -->\n    ReviewAll[\"1. Review Entire Process<br>From plan to final implementation\"] -->\n    AnalyzeProcess[\"2. Analyze Process & Outcomes<br>What went well? What didn't?\"] -->\n    AssessDesigns[\"3. Assess Design Decisions<br>How effective were the creative choices?\"] -->\n    ExtractLessons[\"4. Extract Key Lessons<br>Technical, process, and team takeaways\"] -->\n    DefineActions[\"5. Define Actionable Items<br>What will we do differently next time?\"] -->\n    CreateReflectDoc[\"6. Create Reflection Document<br>in \`memory-bank/reflection/\`\"] -->\n    UpdateTasks[\"7. Update \`tasks.md`<br>Mark reflection as complete\"] -->\n    ReflectionDone[\"L3 Reflection Complete\"]\n\n    style StartReflect fill:#ba68c8,stroke:#9c27b0\n    style ReflectionDone fill:#d1c4e9,stroke:#b39ddb\n\`\`\`\n\n## üìù Structure for \`memory-bank/reflection/reflection-[feature_id].md\`\n\n*   **Feature Title & ID:**\n*   **Completion Date:**\n*   **1. Executive Summary:**\n    *   A brief, high-level summary of the project's outcome. Was it successful? Did it meet its goals?\n*   **2. What Went Well (Successes):**\n    *   List specific aspects of the project that were successful (e.g., \"The modular architecture defined in the creative phase made integration straightforward.\").\n*   **3. What Didn't Go Well (Challenges):**\n    *   List specific challenges encountered (e.g., \"We underestimated the complexity of integrating with the external API, leading to delays.\").\n*   **4. Assessment of Key Decisions:**\n    *   Review the main design/architectural decisions. Were they the right choices? What were the consequences?\n*   **5. Key Lessons Learned:**\n    *   **Technical:** What did we learn about the technologies used?\n    *   **Process:** What could we improve in our workflow (planning, testing, etc.)?\n    *   **Team/Collaboration:** What did we learn about how we work together?\n*   **6. Actionable Improvements for Next Time:**\n    *   Create a concrete list of things to do differently in the future (e.g., \"Allocate a dedicated spike task for analyzing any new external API.\", \"Update our component template to include accessibility attributes by default.\").\n*   **7. Time Estimation Accuracy:**\n    *   Estimated Time vs. Actual Time.\n    *   Analysis of any significant variance.\n\n## ‚úÖ L3 Reflection Completion Checklist\n\n- [ ] The entire feature lifecycle has been reviewed.\n- [ ] Successes, challenges, and lessons are documented honestly and specifically.\n- [ ] The effectiveness of key design choices has been assessed.\n- [ ] A list of concrete, actionable improvements has been created.\n- [ ] The reflection document has been created and saved in the correct location.\n- [ ] \`tasks.md\` has been updated to show the reflection phase is complete.\n\n**Next Step:** Proceed to the ARCHIVING phase (\`Level3/archive-intermediate.mdc\`).\n" > ./.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/Level3/reflection-intermediate.mdc
```

```bash
printf -- "---\ndescription: Structures the reflection process for completed Level 3 intermediate features to extract lessons and identify improvements.\nglobs: reflection-intermediate.mdc\nalwaysApply: false\n---\n\n# LEVEL 3 REFLECTION: INTERMEDIATE FEATURE\n\n> **TL;DR:** This guide provides a structured format for reflecting on a completed Level 3 feature, focusing on analyzing the development process, assessing design choices, and extracting actionable lessons for future work.\n\n## üöÄ Before You Start Reflecting (L3 Pre-Reflection Checklist)\n\n1.  **Confirm Implementation Complete:** Verify in \`tasks.md\` that the implementation and testing for the feature are marked as complete.\n2.  **Gather All Feature-Specific Documents:** Have the feature plan (\`tasks.md\`), all creative decision documents (\`creative-*.md\`), and key progress notes (\`progress.md\`) available for review.\n3.  **Allocate Time:** Set aside dedicated time to think critically about the project. Rushed reflections are less valuable.\n\n## üîÑ Level 3 Reflection Workflow\n\n\`\`\`mermaid\ngraph TD\n    StartReflect[\"Start L3 Reflection\"] -->\n    ReviewAll[\"1. Review Entire Process<br>From plan to final implementation\"] -->\n    AnalyzeProcess[\"2. Analyze Process & Outcomes<br>What went well? What didn't?\"] -->\n    AssessDesigns[\"3. Assess Design Decisions<br>How effective were the creative choices?\"] -->\n    ExtractLessons[\"4. Extract Key Lessons<br>Technical, process, and team takeaways\"] -->\n    DefineActions[\"5. Define Actionable Items<br>What will we do differently next time?\"] -->\n    CreateReflectDoc[\"6. Create Reflection Document<br>in \`memory-bank/reflection/\`\"] -->\n    UpdateTasks[\"7. Update \`tasks.md`<br>Mark reflection as complete\"] -->\n    ReflectionDone[\"L3 Reflection Complete\"]\n\n    style StartReflect fill:#ba68c8,stroke:#9c27b0\n    style ReflectionDone fill:#d1c4e9,stroke:#b39ddb\n\`\`\`\n\n## üìù Structure for \`memory-bank/reflection-[feature_id].md\`\n\n*   **Feature Title & ID:**\n*   **Completion Date:**\n*   **1. Executive Summary:**\n    *   A brief, high-level summary of the project's outcome. Was it successful? Did it meet its goals?\n*   **2. What Went Well (Successes):**\n    *   List specific aspects of the project that were successful (e.g., \"The modular architecture defined in the creative phase made integration straightforward.\").\n*   **3. What Didn't Go Well (Challenges):**\n    *   List specific challenges encountered (e.g., \"We underestimated the complexity of integrating with the external API, leading to delays.\").\n*   **4. Assessment of Key Decisions:**\n    *   Review the main design/architectural decisions. Were they the right choices? What were the consequences?\n*   **5. Key Lessons Learned:**\n    *   **Technical:** What did we learn about the technologies used?\n    *   **Process:** What could we improve in our workflow (planning, testing, etc.)?\n    *   **Team/Collaboration:** What did we learn about how we work together?\n*   **6. Actionable Improvements for Next Time:**\n    *   Create a concrete list of things to do differently in the future (e.g., \"Allocate a dedicated spike task for analyzing any new external API.\", \"Update our component template to include accessibility attributes by default.\").\n*   **7. Time Estimation Accuracy:**\n    *   Estimated Time vs. Actual Time.\n    *   Analysis of any significant variance.\n\n## ‚úÖ L3 Reflection Completion Checklist\n\n- [ ] The entire feature lifecycle has been reviewed.\n- [ ] Successes, challenges, and lessons are documented honestly and specifically.\n- [ ] The effectiveness of key design choices has been assessed.\n- [ ] A list of concrete, actionable improvements has been created.\n- [ ] The reflection document has been created and saved in the correct location.\n- [ ] \`tasks.md\` has been updated to show the reflection phase is complete.\n\n**Next Step:** Proceed to the ARCHIVING phase (\`Level3/archive-intermediate.mdc\`).\n" > ./.cursor/rules/isolation_rules/Level3/reflection-intermediate.mdc
```
